get.description: List all analyses for a project

post.description: Create and launch an analysis for a project

get.description: List all analyses for a project (light)
Get an Analysis detail
Return global statistics for an analysis
Return crawl statistics grouped by time frequency (1 min, 5 mins or 60 min) for an analysis

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of elements to retrieve

get.description: Return a list of 1000 latest URLs crawled (all crawled URLs or only URLS with HTTP errors)

parameters.name: list_type
parameters.description: URLs list type (crawled URLs or error URLs)

get.description: Legacy    List of Orphan URLs. URLs which generated visits from the selected source according to Google Analytics data, but were not crawled with by the Botify crawler (either because no links to them were found on the website, or because the crawler was not allowed to follow these links according to the project settings).   For a search engine (medium: origanic; sources: all, aol, ask, baidu, bing, google, naver, yahoo, yandex) or a social network (medium: social; sources: all, facebook, google+, linkedin, pinterest, reddit, tumblr, twitter)

parameters.name: medium
parameters.description: Type of traffic, value: 'organic' (from search engine)or 'social' (from a social network)

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Traffic source, value: name of the search engine or social network

get.description: Get inlinks percentiles
Lost pagerank
Scoring summary
List clicks and impressions per day
Get global information of the sitemaps found (sitemaps indexes, invalid sitemaps urls, etc.)

Sample list of URLs which were found in your sitemaps but outside of the crawl perimeter defined for the project, for instance domain/subdomain or protocol (HTTP/HTTPS) not allowed in the crawl settings.
Sample list of URLs which were found in your sitemaps, within the project allowed scope (allowed domains/subdomains/protocols), but not found by the Botify crawler.
Top domains
Top subddomains

List of Orphan URLs. URLs which generated visits from the selected source according to Google Analytics data, but were not crawled with by the Botify crawler (either because no links to them were found on the website, or because the crawler was not allowed to follow these links according to the project settings).   For a search engine (medium: origanic; sources: all, aol, ask, baidu, bing, google, naver, yahoo, yandex) or a social network (medium: social; sources: all, facebook, google+, linkedin, pinterest, reddit, tumblr, twitter)

parameters.name: medium
parameters.description: Type of traffic, value: 'organic' (from search engine)or 'social' (from a social network)

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Traffic source, value: name of the search engine or social network

post.description: Clone all keyword groups of the current project to another one.  This endpoint is a little more general (for further use). That's why you will see a 'type' field (with a default value of: 'keywords').

parameters.name: ValuesListCloneRequestBody
parameters.description: JSON body to use as request body for ValuesList clone operation

get.description: Get the datasources details for all projects of a user
List all active projects for the user

pages_locations.description: Location of some specific types of pages. Ex: {'category': {'segmentationSlug': 'pagetype', 'segmentValue': 'product'}}

products_count_html_extract.description: HTML Extract used to count the number of products on listing pages.

username.description: Required. 30 characters or fewer. Letters, numbers and /-/_/. characters

hide_collection.description: If True, the corresponding collection will not be publicly visible.

trigger.description: The trigger that will start the job automation.

excluded_from_trends.description: If yes, this crawl will be excluded from trends data

has_raw_pages.description: If yes, this crawl has raw HTML pages

SearchConsoleConfiguration.description: Configuration for the Search Console keywords page

pipelines.description: List of ML Pipeline active for the project

file_format.description: Select the format of your file

file_encoding.description: Use this field only if the sent files cannot be decoded in utf-8. Note that this will affect the decoding of ALL files and slow down ingestion

filename_regex.description: Regex to find date in filename (only needed for S3)

filename_date_format.description: Format of the date in filename (only needed for S3)

provider_autoimport.description: If desired, select the provider for auto-import

currency.description: Define the currency in the ISO 4217 Currency Code, e.g., USD, EUR, CAD

max_months_to_pull_first_data_ingestion.description: Max. months to pull until there's a successful datasource revision

max_step_months_to_pull.description: Max. additional months to pull at every datasource revision

max_months_to_pull.description: Max. past months to pull for the datasource

description.description:
Description of the use case
Note that use of HTML is authorized.

use_crawl_full_scope.description: Do you want to base Alert Panel alerts computation on all URLs crawled?

allowed_domains.description:
Enter a valid JSON object
All domains listed here are used to filter the logs: the BLA dashboard will only contain URLs from allowed domains
ex: ["www.domain.com", "sub.domain.com"]

max_files.description: Max files ingested in first revision

sync_status.description:
No Auto-sync: Client does not automatically deliver their logs.
Auto-sync: Client automatically deliver their logs.
Frozen: Client is supposed to deliver logs but doesn't (exclude from monitoring).

max_acceptable_delay.description: Last uploaded file alerts threshold (hours) - 26 hours if null (Ex: put '72:00:00' for 72 hours)

reject_urls_after_nb_days.description: Reject URL from history after nb_days not crawled and 0 visit

v2_closed.description: BLA V2 closed for this project

v3_enabled.description: BLA V3 enabled for this project

v34_enabled.description: Enable BLA V3.4 computation (independent from BLA V3)

send_daily_email.description: Send an email when finishing the update workflow

archive.description: Keep only crawl and visit lines, compress into zst and archive result on S3

archive_region.description: Region where 'archive' processing takes place / storage is always in the US

subdomain_ignore_depth_after.description: Depth of subdomain to ignore in host segmentation (1: replace foo in foo.bar.example.com with '*')

stop_after_normalization.description: Should the log workflow stop after the normalization ?

only_push_events.description: Should the log workflow stop after events tables are pushed?

sampling_enabled.description: SHOULD ONLY BE SET AT PROJECT SETUP. DO NOT ENABLE WITHOUT SPEAKING TO DEVS. Enables normalization sampling feature.

sampling_by_url_pct.description: How many urls to keep out of a 100. Will only keep urls where url_hash % 100 < value.

ignore_rendering_crawls.description: Should we ignore rendering lines (bots api calls) when normalizing files?

max_gsc_via_bq_websites.description: Maximum number of GSC properties that can be activated using BigQuery bulk export

realkeywords_aggregation_type.description: If 'New: By website & by URL' is selected, data will be shown aggregated by website wherever possible in RealKeywords

full_export_base_uri.description: This field declares the base location where to store full exports, eg: s3://foo.bar/botify_exports/

full_export_host.description: Host of the bucket where to store full exports, eg: s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com

full_export_canonical_user_ids.description: Optional field that declares the list of ids of the canonical users to allow the access full export files. Use comma to separate values.

full_export_create_uri_method.description:
Determine the method that will be used in order to build the path where the advanced export file will be stored on the remote S3 Bucket.
DEFAULT = s3://[base]/[project_slug]/[crawl_slug]/[export_type]
AMAZON = s3://[base]/[export_type]/[project_slug]/[export_slug]/
Note: It also remove 'amazon' from the project slug

use_portal_proxy_metal.description: Do not enable unless you know what you are doing.

google_analytics_account_email.description: Keep email in case user delete his social auth connection

slug.description: Derived from the name, then immutable

type.description: for further use only, the type of ValuesList to clone (default to 'keywords')

ValuesListCloneRequestBody.description: JSON body to use as request body for ValuesList clone operation

include_pattern.description: Pattern that matches the desired file names. You can use `date` or `timestamp` group to filter by date. Eg: "(?P<timestamp>[0-9]{10})-site.log" or "^xxx-(?P<date>[0-9]+).log$". If you use monotonic buckets, please use .*$ as a pattern as the include pattern will not work with merged files, please try to use the prefix pattern in the bucket if that's possible

line_hook.description: This field must declare at least a method called hook(line)

force_https.description: Transform the URLs in HTTPS (force to start with "https://")

SearchConsoleViaBQ.description: Configuration for the Search Console via BQ import on keywords page

creation_time.description: The time when the payload is created

type.description:
type of activation to perform.
        UPDATE: update the existing activations. new pipelines will be combined with the existing. in case of conflict, an error will be raised.
        OVERRIDE: create or override the existing activations

projects.description: List of projects to activate ML pipelines

pipelines.description: List of ML Pipeline active for all projects

airlock_delete.description: Delete file from airlock after being archived

archives_is_airlock_alias.description: If files are not deleted from airlock, consider archives as airlock bucket

block_file_if_found_in_bucket.description: Block file import if same location if found on target bucket

name.description: Pipeline Name should match AWS Sagemaker Trial Name Pattern

sagemaker_pipeline.description: SageMaker Pipeline name should match AWS Sagemaker Pattern

strategy.description: Pick the execution strategy of the pipeline

datasource_name.description: Only valid when DATASOURCE is selected, valid values such as: conversion, search_console,...

bq_index.description: Name of the column uploaded to s3 by the pipeline to use as an index when uploaded to BigQuery

data_version.description: This field is only used for datasource-related pipelines. Changing its value would reset existing data

predefined_parameters.description: List of parameters to compute and pass to sagemaker workflow. Supported parameters include ProjectId, BQtable, OutputPrefix

fixed_parameters.description: Parameters that don't depend on the client such as ML hyperparameters

blocking.description: Should block the workflow that launches this

required_crawl_features.description: List of features that must be successful on a crawl in order for the pipeline to be launched

one_of_required_crawl_features.description: At least one feature in this list must be successful on a crawl in order for the pipeline to be launched

crawl_type.description: Type(s) of crawl on which the pipeline should be launched

can_be_api_triggered.description: Pipeline can be triggered using an API call

should_be_trended.description: If True, a trended table for the data of this pipeline will be created and updated for each launch

retries.description: Number of retries of the SageMaker pipeline if it fails

DefaultPayload.description: default payload for object for all HTTP codes that are not covered individually
